channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Many women struggle to lose belly fat in middle age. Here’s some expert help
item.description: The loss of estrogen in menopause is strongly associated with a change in body composition.

item.title: How to play the Fed decision using options on gold
item.description: Tony Zhang breaks down a spread trade in the SPDR Gold Shares.

item.title: BlackRock, Microsoft and partners launch $100 billion AI data-center venture
Jamie Dimon tells Gen Z to stop wasting its time on TikTok and read books instead
item.description: "If you're a Democrat, read the Republican opinion ... if you're a Republican read the Democrat one. Read history books. You can't make it up."

item.title: Lunar company Intuitive Machines' stock jumps nearly 60% after NASA moon satellite contract
item.description: NASA said the company was the sole awardee for a "lunar relay systems" contract, which has a maximum total value of $4.82 billion over five years.

item.title: Stock indexes near all-time highs with Wall Street on Fed watch — live coverage
Nikki Haley’s new weekly SiriusXM talk show will last until a new president takes office
item.description: Haley says it may continue beyond that "if Americans like what they hear."

item.title: WNBA to add expansion team in Portland, bringing league to 15 franchises
item.description: The WNBA is adding another team in Portland in 2026, joining other expansion franchises in San Francisco and Toronto.

item.title: U.S. new-home construction picked up in August
Here’s where to get a free burger on National Cheeseburger Day
item.description: Your lunch (and dinner!) plans are set.

item.title: Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max review: Long battery life and great cameras. Apple Intelligence isn't ready
item.description: CNBC's iPhone 16 Pro Max review. There are a lot of good upgrades but Apple Intelligence isn't ready yet.

item.title: U.S. interest rates could be ‘permanently higher’: economist Torsten Slok
Amazon’s back-to-office crusade could backfire, experts say. ‘These shifts cause you to lose people’
item.description: Amazon’s new policy defies data that shows RTO mandates throttle recruitment and aren’t linked with increased productivity.

item.title: An aggressive Fed move is unlikely to spur a surprise Bank of England cut
item.description: Money market pricing for a BOE cut at Thursday's September meeting dipped from 35% late Tuesday to 26% Wednesday morning

item.title: When and how we’ll learn of the Fed rate decision — and hear from Chair Powell
